abstract.p: Zuckerman Fernandes & Partners parts ways with Clos Du Bois wines, owned by Allied Domecq Wines USA, after five years of working on account; billings (S)

block.p: Zuckerman Fernandes & Partners parted ways with Clos Du Bois wines, owned by Allied Domecq Wines U.S.A., after five years of working on the account. Billings were estimated at $4 million.
Ira Zuckerman, chairman at Zuckerman Fernandes in San Francisco, said ''the casts of characters and our respective goals have changed.''
George Rose, a spokesman for Allied Domecq Wines in Healdsburg, Calif., said the account would go up for review ''some time in the spring.''
Zuckerman Fernandes & Partners parted ways with Clos Du Bois wines, owned by Allied Domecq Wines U.S.A., after five years of working on the account. Billings were estimated at $4 million.
Ira Zuckerman, chairman at Zuckerman Fernandes in San Francisco, said ''the casts of characters and our respective goals have changed.''
George Rose, a spokesman for Allied Domecq Wines in Healdsburg, Calif., said the account would go up for review ''some time in the spring.''

In the interim, the agencies that handle the advertising for another Allied Domecq brand, Callaway Coastal, will work on the Clos Du Bois account. They are: Open Minds in Laguna Beach, Calif., and the Ponzi Group in Trabuco Canyon, Calif.
